title: 4K crashes
body: I've just gotten a new monitor that runs in 4k (3840x2160), which I'm running in duel monitor setup with my old 1920x1080 monitor. Upon starting my first game since the change, the game instantly crashed my entire computer, and after restarting and disconnecting my second monitor the problem repeated itself. I tried to find a way to change the resolution outside of actually playing the game (because that's impossible) and it doesn't seem like there is a way anymore, or if it is it's buried under hundreds of complaints from 2010 and whatnot. Is there a way to adjust these settings outside of the game? my game.CFG file is nearly empty.

replies.body:
Technically, you may be able to modify your resolution settings outside the game, but it's far easier to clear out what's stored server-side and have League autodetect your new resolution. You can do this by following the steps below:

First, you'll want to **log into the game** then hop into your config folder, which should be in your install directory:

**C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config**

Delete these two files:
**- input.ini
- PersistedSettings.json**

Once you've deleted these two files, hop into a custom match to confirm the change went through. Let me know if this helped!
